title: Walmart Just Dropped Hundreds of New Black Friday Deals Up to 70% Off
description: These are the 12 best! READ MORE...
author: Morgan Pryor
excerpt: From Drew Barrymore furniture to AirPods!
text: DecoratingShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.This year’s Black Friday is already shaping up to be one for the books. Brands have started rolling out their deals weeks in advance, ranging from Target to Castlery, and they’re all so good that the most stressful part is figuring out where to start. Instead of scrambling the day after Thanksgiving and hoping your wish list items aren’t already sold out, you can shop leisurely and strategize, checking out multiple retailers to see which is offering the lowest price.You’ll likely be able to knock more than one item off of your list if you head to Walmart first. The brand’s enormous sale started last week, but even more products were just marked down yesterday. If you need some new tech gadget, everything from AirPods to TVs are included; if you’ve been meaning to upgrade your furniture, a $730-off sectional and Drew Barrymore bookcase are among the markdowns. There’s truly something for everyone, and we’ve pulled the 12 best items that you should grab sooner rather than later. Scroll for more!1 / 12Walmart$399.99was $649.99Dyson is always one of the brands we keep an eye on during sales. Our editors have found that its vacuums reflect a high level of quality, so when they’re available for less, we recommend adding one to your cart ASAP. Save $250 on the V12 Detect, which is Dyson’s lightest intelligent cordless vacuum​. It reveals dust that’s invisible to the eye, adjusts its suction automatically, and runs for 60 minutes on a full charge, all while taking up minimal space.2 / 12Walmart$298.00was $376.00Drew Barrymore’s Beautiful line lives up to its name with this stunning bookcase. You can leave it as-is with the three shelves and put all of your decor on display, or remove a few and turn it into a TV stand. Either way, the fluted detailing on the cabinet doors and warm finish will make it the focal piece of your living room.3 / 12Walmart$17.99was $62.99Over 2,000 shoppers have given this sheet set a perfect rating, so it’s definitely worth considering when it’s over 70% off. The material is tightly woven using 90 GSM microfiber, as well as double brushed on both sides. The brand says that the process makes it “softer than Egyptian and organic cotton.” Many shoppers confirm that they deliver in terms of coziness and fit, both of which are impressive for the price.4 / 12Walmart$378.00was $498.00Black Friday is one of the best times to snag a big ticket item like a TV. This one from TCL is a whopping 75 inches, but is going for under $400. You can view movies and shows in 4K and at four times the resolution of Full HD, and you can experience them with the model’s improved motion clarity. Plus, you’ll get over 250 live TV channels and more entertainment options for free!5 / 12Walmart$94.00was $169.00Apple has put several of its items on sale, too, including these third-generation AirPods. If you have yet to switch from your wired headphones or you have an older model, this is your sign to upgrade to this version. The Personalized Spatial Audio technology makes sound feel like it’s surrounding you, and a full charge lasts for six hours.6 / 12Walmart$38.99was $109.99If you’re in desperate need for more storage in your kitchen — or pretty much anywhere else in your home — this unit is the solution you’ve been looking for. Already sold out in two colors, shoppers love that it’s collapsible, and each shelf supports up to 250 pounds. Finally, you can clear all of your appliances off of the counter!7 / 12Walmart$539.99was $1268.48A stylish sectional for only $540? Yes, please! This sofa has double-layer cushions for extra comfort, as well as fluffy armrests. The seats are wide, too, and you can move the footrest so that you can lounge to the fullest. “It looks amazing and it's very comfortable,” says a shopper. ”On a scale of cloud couch to firm, I'd say it's cloud-medium. You don't totally sink into it, but it's not firm either.”8 / 12Walmart$29.88was $59.00This Keurig machine will make brewing your morning coffee so much easier. Once you put the pod in, you’ll have a high-quality cup in minutes, and you don’t have to wait for it to reheat to make another one right away. The large water reservoir streamlines the process, too. $30 is a small price to pay for all of that!9 / 12Walmart$449.00was $1899.00If your mattress has seen better days and has been impacting your sleep, Black Friday should inspire you to swap it out for a newer one. Serta’s mattress is over $1000 off, and it checks a ton of boxes: suited for stomach and back sleepers, a breathable cover, contouring and cradling support. One reviewer confirmed that they feel no motion transfer when their partner is on the other side of the bed.10 / 12Walmart$18.88was $49.99Waking up shivering or drenched in sweat because of a too-thin or too-thick comforter is an awful feeling, which is why an all-season comforter is an undeniable essential. This option comes in at a great price point and offers all of the versatility you could ever need, using a special composite of synthetic fibers to absorb heat and moisture.11 / 12Walmart$49.99was $64.98You’ve probably seen cross-legged office chairs all over TikTok, and this is your chance to see what they’re all about. The extra wide seat and back provide total comfort, allowing you to adjust throughout the workday. When you’re not in work mode, it even tilts back so that you can lean and relax.12 / 12Walmart$229.00was $549.00Speaking of work, over 1,000 shoppers have bought this workhorse of a laptop since yesterday. It has the power of a reliable Intel processor, plenty of storage, a crisp display, a Full HD resolution with a camera, noise-reduction software — all for over $300 less than usual.Apartment Therapy's Home RunsGet full reviews of editor-favorite finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Decorating
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

This year’s Black Friday is already shaping up to be one for the books. Brands have started rolling out their deals weeks in advance, ranging from Target to Castlery, and they’re all so good that the most stressful part is figuring out where to start. Instead of scrambling the day after Thanksgiving and hoping your wish list items aren’t already sold out, you can shop leisurely and strategize, checking out multiple retailers to see which is offering the lowest price.

You’ll likely be able to knock more than one item off of your list if you head to Walmart first. The brand’s enormous sale started last week, but even more products were just marked down yesterday. If you need some new tech gadget, everything from AirPods to TVs are included; if you’ve been meaning to upgrade your furniture, a $730-off sectional and Drew Barrymore bookcase are among the markdowns. There’s truly something for everyone, and we’ve pulled the 12 best items that you should grab sooner rather than later. Scroll for more!

1 / 12

Walmart

$399.99

was $649.99

Dyson is always one of the brands we keep an eye on during sales. Our editors have found that its vacuums reflect a high level of quality, so when they’re available for less, we recommend adding one to your cart ASAP. Save $250 on the V12 Detect, which is Dyson’s lightest intelligent cordless vacuum​. It reveals dust that’s invisible to the eye, adjusts its suction automatically, and runs for 60 minutes on a full charge, all while taking up minimal space.

2 / 12

Walmart

$298.00

was $376.00

Drew Barrymore’s Beautiful line lives up to its name with this stunning bookcase. You can leave it as-is with the three shelves and put all of your decor on display, or remove a few and turn it into a TV stand. Either way, the fluted detailing on the cabinet doors and warm finish will make it the focal piece of your living room.

3 / 12

Walmart

$17.99

was $62.99

Over 2,000 shoppers have given this sheet set a perfect rating, so it’s definitely worth considering when it’s over 70% off. The material is tightly woven using 90 GSM microfiber, as well as double brushed on both sides. The brand says that the process makes it “softer than Egyptian and organic cotton.” Many shoppers confirm that they deliver in terms of coziness and fit, both of which are impressive for the price.

4 / 12

Walmart

$378.00

was $498.00

Black Friday is one of the best times to snag a big ticket item like a TV. This one from TCL is a whopping 75 inches, but is going for under $400. You can view movies and shows in 4K and at four times the resolution of Full HD, and you can experience them with the model’s improved motion clarity. Plus, you’ll get over 250 live TV channels and more entertainment options for free!

5 / 12

Walmart

$94.00

was $169.00

Apple has put several of its items on sale, too, including these third-generation AirPods. If you have yet to switch from your wired headphones or you have an older model, this is your sign to upgrade to this version. The Personalized Spatial Audio technology makes sound feel like it’s surrounding you, and a full charge lasts for six hours.

6 / 12

Walmart

$38.99

was $109.99

If you’re in desperate need for more storage in your kitchen — or pretty much anywhere else in your home — this unit is the solution you’ve been looking for. Already sold out in two colors, shoppers love that it’s collapsible, and each shelf supports up to 250 pounds. Finally, you can clear all of your appliances off of the counter!

7 / 12

Walmart

$539.99

was $1268.48

A stylish sectional for only $540? Yes, please! This sofa has double-layer cushions for extra comfort, as well as fluffy armrests. The seats are wide, too, and you can move the footrest so that you can lounge to the fullest. “It looks amazing and it's very comfortable,” says a shopper. ”On a scale of cloud couch to firm, I'd say it's cloud-medium. You don't totally sink into it, but it's not firm either.”

8 / 12

Walmart

$29.88

was $59.00

This Keurig machine will make brewing your morning coffee so much easier. Once you put the pod in, you’ll have a high-quality cup in minutes, and you don’t have to wait for it to reheat to make another one right away. The large water reservoir streamlines the process, too. $30 is a small price to pay for all of that!

9 / 12

Walmart

$449.00

was $1899.00

If your mattress has seen better days and has been impacting your sleep, Black Friday should inspire you to swap it out for a newer one. Serta’s mattress is over $1000 off, and it checks a ton of boxes: suited for stomach and back sleepers, a breathable cover, contouring and cradling support. One reviewer confirmed that they feel no motion transfer when their partner is on the other side of the bed.

10 / 12

Walmart

$18.88

was $49.99

Waking up shivering or drenched in sweat because of a too-thin or too-thick comforter is an awful feeling, which is why an all-season comforter is an undeniable essential. This option comes in at a great price point and offers all of the versatility you could ever need, using a special composite of synthetic fibers to absorb heat and moisture.

11 / 12

Walmart

$49.99

was $64.98

You’ve probably seen cross-legged office chairs all over TikTok, and this is your chance to see what they’re all about. The extra wide seat and back provide total comfort, allowing you to adjust throughout the workday. When you’re not in work mode, it even tilts back so that you can lean and relax.

12 / 12

Walmart

$229.00

was $549.00

Speaking of work, over 1,000 shoppers have bought this workhorse of a laptop since yesterday. It has the power of a reliable Intel processor, plenty of storage, a crisp display, a Full HD resolution with a camera, noise-reduction software — all for over $300 less than usual.
